title: Foreign-grain contamination
vignette: A grain silo of wheat is discovered to contain about 8 % rye kernels, above the legal purity limit.

options.text: Lower the admixture to within the allowable threshold (remove rye or dilute with more wheat).
Remove every rye kernel, leaving only pure wheat.

title: Switching crops mid-season
vignette: A field is already sprouting wheat, but the owner now prefers to plant barley for a better contract.

options.text: Wait until the wheat residues decay, then plough and reseed with barley.
Sow barley immediately and plough the mixed growth later.

title: Cereal plants in a vineyard
vignette: Volunteer wheat shoots appear between rows of grapevines at a winery.

options.text: Destroy both the grain and the vines as a prohibited mixture.
Uproot the wheat and keep the vines intact.

title: Cross-grafting fruit trees
vignette: An orchard manager wants to graft apricot branches onto plum rootstock to produce hardier fruit.

options.text: Allow the graft for agricultural benefit.
Prohibit any cross-species grafting.

title: Yoking mismatched draft animals
vignette: A farmer harnesses a donkey and an ox together to pull a wagon on a long haul.

options.text: Prohibited; both driver and even a passive passenger are liable.
Permit in emergencies (e.g., urgent medical evacuation).

title: Passenger’s liability for mixed team
vignette: A passenger rides in a wagon pulled by a mixed-species team while the driver controls the reins.

options.text: Penalise both driver and passenger.
Penalise only the driver; the passenger is exempt.

title: Breeding hybrids of uncertain lineage
vignette: Two mules of unknown parent species are bred together.

options.text: Permit, since lineage doubts make enforcement impractical.
Forbid any breeding when hybrid status is uncertain.

title: Mixed-fiber coat used for smuggling
vignette: A smuggler wears an oversized wool-linen blend coat over many layers to hide items from customs agents.

options.text: Still forbidden; wearing the blend is never excused.
Permit since the coat is worn only as concealment, not for comfort.

title: Mixed-fiber barber capes
vignette: A barber drapes clients with capes made from a wool-linen blend during haircuts.

options.text: Allow; the fabric is merely handled, not worn for benefit.
Forbid; any skin contact risks violation.

title: Mixed-fiber burial shroud
vignette: Relatives prepare a wool-linen blend shroud for a deceased family member.

options.text: Permit; the deceased are exempt from commandments.
Forbid; mixing species is disrespectful even after death.

title: Retailer modeling mixed-fiber clothing
vignette: A store clerk briefly tries on a wool-linen blend jacket to show its fit to a customer.

options.text: Permit if there is no intent to benefit from warmth.
Ban it—any form of wearing counts regardless of intent.

title: Planting look-alike vegetables
vignette: A gardener plants turnips right beside radishes; their leaves are visually indistinguishable.

options.text: Treat them as the same kind; mixture allowed.
Appearance is irrelevant; botanical species determine the rule and mixing is banned.

title: Sabotage seeding in a vineyard
vignette: A rival secretly scatters wheat seeds throughout another person’s vineyard to cause losses.

options.text: Destroy both the wheat and the vines.
Destroy only the wheat; spare the vines.

title: Hiring others to plant hybrids
vignette: A landowner contracts an outside crew to plant prohibited hybrid crops on his land.

options.text: Permit; he is not planting with his own hands.
Forbid; causing another to break the rule is still wrong.

title: Keeping an illegally grafted tree
vignette: An orchard contains a tree that was cross-grafted years ago; the current owner did not perform the graft.

options.text: Uproot the tree; ongoing benefit remains forbidden.
Leave it standing; only new grafting is prohibited.
